intro: Scleranthus perennis subsp. polycnemoides, commonly known as the perennial sow-thistle, is a flowering plant in the family Amaranthaceae. It is characterized by its upright, branched stems and alternate, lanceolate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in dense clusters, typically blooming from late spring to early autumn. It is native to Europe and parts of Asia, often found in disturbed soils such as roadsides and fields. This species is known for its ability to thrive in a variety of soil types and its tolerance to environmental stress.
